Line 61: Line 61:
After the successful overthrow of the Ben Ali regime, a number of self-immolation protests have taken place in Arab republics. In [[Algeria]], [[Mohsen bouterfif|Mohsen Bouterfif]] set himself on fire after a meeting with a town mayor failed in finding employment and housing on January 13, 2011. He later died of his wounds. Also in Algeria, another man attempted but failed to burn himself.<ref>[http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/2011/jan/16/tunisia-protests-suicide-algeria-arab Tunisia's protests spark suicide in Algeria and fears through Arab world]</ref> In [[Egypt]], Abdou Abdel-Moneim Jaafar, a 49-year-old restaurant owner, set himself alight in front of the Egyptian Parliament.<ref>[http://english.ahram.org.eg/NewsContent/1/2/4115/Egypt/Society/In-Egypt,-man-sets-himself-on-fire.aspx In Egypt, man sets himself on fire, driven by economic woes]</ref>
After the successful overthrow of the Ben Ali regime, a number of self-immolation protests have taken place in Arab republics. In [[Algeria]], [[Mohsen bouterfif|Mohsen Bouterfif]] set himself on fire after a meeting with a town mayor failed in finding employment and housing on January 13, 2011. He later died of his wounds. Also in Algeria, another man attempted but failed to burn himself.<ref>[http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/2011/jan/16/tunisia-protests-suicide-algeria-arab Tunisia's protests spark suicide in Algeria and fears through Arab world]</ref> In [[Egypt]], Abdou Abdel-Moneim Jaafar, a 49-year-old restaurant owner, set himself alight in front of the Egyptian Parliament.<ref>[http://english.ahram.org.eg/NewsContent/1/2/4115/Egypt/Society/In-Egypt,-man-sets-himself-on-fire.aspx In Egypt, man sets himself on fire, driven by economic woes]</ref>
â
* [[Mohsen Bouterfif]] from [[Algeria]], died of self-immolation in 2011 during the [[2011 Algerian riots]].
+
